data: narrow pass west of Pike’s Peak

The blizzard snorted and raged at midnight up the narrow pass west of Pike’s Peak, at the bottom of which lay the railroad track, and with this tumult of the elements the snow was falling in masses which were caught up and tossed about in the gale until the air was but a white, swirling, yeasty mass through which nothing could be seen a yard away.
The Cassowary; What Chanced in the Cleft Mountains
